<<<<<<< HEAD
Certeyne preceptes, gathered by Hulrichus Zuinglius, declaring how the ingenious youth ought to be instructed and brought vnto Christ. Translated out of latin into Inglish by master Richard Argentyne Doctour in Physyck Quo pacto ingenui formandi sint praeceptiones pauculae. English Zwingli, Ulrich, 1484-1531. Argentine, Richard, d. 1568.
[46] p.
By Anthony Scoloker. dwellyng in. S. Nycholas paryshe, Imprinted at Ippeswich : Anno. 1548.
A translation, by Richard Argentine, of: Zwingli, Ulrich. Quo pacto ingenui formandi sint praeceptiones pauculae. At foot of title page: Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum. Signatures: a-c (C7 blank, -C8, also blank?). Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
Certeyne preceptes, gathered by Hulrichus Zuinglius, declaring how the ingenious youth ought to be instructed and brought vnto Christ. Translated out of latin into Inglish by master Richard Argentyne Doctour in Physyck Quo pacto ingenui formandi sint praeceptiones pauculae. English Zwingli, Ulrich, 1484-1531. Argentine, Richard, d. 1568.
[46] p.
By Anthony Scoloker. dwellyng in. S. Nycholas paryshe, Imprinted at Ippeswich : Anno. 1548.
A translation, by Richard Argentine, of: Zwingli, Ulrich. Quo pacto ingenui formandi sint praeceptiones pauculae. At foot of title page: Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum. Signatures: a-c (C7 blank, -C8, also blank?). Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
Anthony Scoloker.
. S. Nycholas paryshe
